item.title: Kingdom Hearts Announced for Steam
item.description:
Highlights

  • Kingdom Hearts is expanding to Steam with popular titles like HD 1.5 + 2.5 ReMIX and Kingdom Hearts 3 on June 13, pleasing fans.
  • Kingdom Hearts 4, set for a 2025 release, has fans eager due to leaked gameplay and official trailer showcasing progress.
  • Square Enix's move to bring Kingdom Hearts to Steam hints at a larger multiplatform strategy to reach more gamers.

Kingdom Hearts is arriving on Steam in June. Gamers have wanted Kingdom Hearts on multiple platforms for a long time, and as hardware has improved, many have begun to consider some of the biggest releases in the iconic series trapped on older, less capable hardware, such as the PS2. In 2021, Kingdom Hearts was announced for PC on the Epic Games Store, and to celebrate the series' anniversary in 2022, the series came to Switch in cloud versions.

It appears that there are upcoming plans for the Kingdom Hearts series that might be fast approaching. Since the release of Kingdom Hearts 3 in 2019, fans have been looking forward to Kingdom Hearts 4 , which received an official announcement trailer in April 2022. Recently, known leaker Daniel Ritchtman stated that Kingdom Hearts 4 will release in 2025 , which has gamers excited, and because of the gameplay shown in the announcement trailer for Kingdom Hearts 4, some fans believe the game may be further along in its development cycle than anticipated.

Related
Kingdom Hearts 4 Has The Perfect Blueprint For an Unexpected Disney World

Kingdom Hearts 4 has many exciting directions it can go, but one Disney movie could be the perfect foundation for an interesting world.

The Kingdom Hearts series has been announced for Steam through social media. The post from the Kingdom Hearts account states that HD 1.5 + 2.5 ReMIX , HD 2.8 Final Chapter Prologue , as well as Kingdom Hearts 3 and its Re Mind DLC are headed to the popular gaming platform on June 13. Many gamers have been requesting that the series come to Steam, as plenty simply prefer the platform over the Epic Games Store and have more of their games over on Steam. The move to Steam indicates immediate movement on Square Enix's stated plan to aggressively pursue a multiplatform strategy .

Although fans are excited about Kingdom Hearts ' presence on new platforms, some are concerned about the status of the series. Although leaks indicate a release by next year , updates for Kingdom Hearts 4 have been scarce since its first trailer . Some fans have called back to the last time there was a gap between numbered Kingdom Hearts releases, hoping that there will not be a similar 14-year wait. While the status of Kingdom Hearts 4 is unknown, Square Enix appears to be making big changes as a company.

Kingdom Hearts on Steam Could Indicate Square Enix's Next Plans

Following the news that Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth has underperformed along with other Square Enix releases, the company appears to be shifting its overall strategy when it comes to producing and selling games. Reports highlight Square Enix's plans to restructure , and combined with the multiplatform strategy, it is clear that the company is interested in making safer decisions going forward. This may mean that when Kingdom Hearts 4 does release, the game could be on even more systems, such as the upcoming Switch successor.

item.title: Call of Duty Gundam Crossover Cosmetics Leaked
item.description:
Highlights

  • The Call of Duty and Gundam crossover in Season 4 will introduce new operator skins based on iconic mecha from the Mobile Suit Gundam series.
  • Bandai Namco aims to reach new audiences by collaborating with the massive fanbase of Call of Duty, blending tactical style with colorful mecha visuals.
  • Leaked promo images reveal the Gundam skins will feature adapted appearances, weapon visuals, and iconic mobile suits like the RX-78-2 Gundam and Zaku II.

New leaks are giving Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 and Warzone players new looks at the games' upcoming crossover with the classic Mobile Suit Gundam mecha anime franchise. The crossover will launch in Season 4 and add new Call of Duty skins based on the titular Gundam mecha.

As one of the most popular games in the world, Call of Duty is a cultural phenomenon on its own, so collaborations with other brands are a given. The same is true of Gundam , a genre-defining franchise that fields multiple contenders for the best mecha anime around . Gundam 's owners at Bandai Namco are also keen to spread awareness by banking on the fact that Call of Duty 's massive audience surely holds its own Gundam fans, as well as putting people that might not otherwise give Gundam a chance in contact with its unique concepts and visuals.

Related
Call of Duty Gundam Crossover Announced

Bandai Namco announces an unexpected crossover between Call of Duty and the legendary mecha anime series Mobile Suit Gundam.

Now a leak from Call of Duty news account CharlieIntel showed off which of the Gundam series the Call of Duty Gundam crossover will draw from. The leak shows off promo images of the three new Gundam -themed operator skins coming alongside other changes set for Call of Duty Season 4 . According to the leak, the three Call of Duty Gundam crossover skins will use an adapted appearance rather than simply rendering the exact models as they appear in various Gundam anime series.

Call of Duty Gundam Skins are Based on Mobile Suit Gundam and The Witch From Mercury

Though not yet officially confirmed at the time of publication, the leaked promo images align with the appearance of a Gundam skin posted to the official Call of Duty social media accounts. Unlike the way Space Marine outfits were almost unchanged for the Call of Duty and Warhammer 40K crossover event , the Gundam skins blend the "tactical" style of Call of Duty with the brightly-colored silhouettes of the mecha. The costumes use weapon harnesses, pouches, and gun belts mixed with armor and helmets from the show's mecha. In a way, they look like human-sized soldiers wearing elaborate Gundam cosplay outfits over their normal combat gear.

Two of the three skins are based on iconic mobile suits from the original 1979 Mobile Suit Gundam anime series: The RX-78-2 Gundam piloted by Amuro Ray, and the customized, red MS-06S Zaku II piloted by Amuro's nemesis Char Aznable. The third skin is based on the XVX-016 Gundam Aerial, the main Gundam from The Witch From Mercury .

The Gundam skins also include weapon visuals based on iconic weapons. The RX-78-2 Gundam pack includes a shield made to look like the Gundam's telltale red shield with a star insignia, and a bright-pink Beam Saber. The Zaku II pack adds bright red colors to two firearms, as well as the Zaku's "Heat Hawk" axe. The Aerial pack includes a second custom shield, as well as sniper rifle and assault rifle customizations that reflect some of the unique visual signifiers from The Witch from Mercury .

item.title: Nintendo Acquires Studio That Worked on Hogwarts Legacy, Mortal Kombat Switch Ports
item.description:
Highlights

  • Nintendo surprises fans with Shiver Entertainment acquisition, but promise minimal impact on current fiscal year results.
  • Speculation arises on Shiver's future projects, including possible involvement in ports for the upcoming Nintendo Switch
  • Nintendo's move raises eyebrows in the gaming community amidst a trend of acquisitions by competitors Xbox and Sony.

Nintendo has acquired Shiver Entertainment, Inc., the studio that has been behind the Nintendo Switch ports of games like Hogwarts Legacy and Mortal Kombat 1 . While acquisitions like these can be good news for fans, this one seems to have surprised many in the Nintendo community.

There has been an unprecedented rise in the number of acquisitions by gaming giants like Xbox and Sony in the past few years. From the controversial Activision-Blizzard acquisition by Microsoft to Sony's purchase of Bungie, it's been a series of events nobody would have expected from afar. While fans have been eagerly waiting for Nintendo to follow suit, there haven't been any major acquisitions by Nintendo so far. In fact, Nintendo even said that it's not seeking acquisitions at all, something that has been a point of debate for quite a while now. Amid that, Nintendo's recent move has left many surprised.

Related
Open-World RPG With a Kung Fu Twist Now Available on Nintendo Switch

An open-world role-playing game with kung fu mechanics arrives on the Nintendo Switch just 11 days shy of its third anniversary.

In a recent announcement, Nintendo has announced an all-new acquisition. The studio in question is Shiver Entertainment, the team that has been behind the likes of Nintendo Switch ports for Hogwarts Legacy , Mortal Kombat 1 as well as Mortal Kombat 11 . While the specifics of the deal haven't been revealed, it has been noted that the acquisition will only have a "minor effect" on Nintendo's results for the current fiscal year. Additionally, Shiver Entertainment will now become a wholly owned subsidiary as Nintendo has acquired 100% of the stocks.

Nintendo Fans Think Shiver Entertainment Could Work On Switch 2 Ports

As far as the acquisition prospects go, there don't seem to be a lot of drastic changes on the radar. Nintendo assures that Shiver Entertainment's focus will remain the same even after the acquisition. However, what's notable is the fact that the announcement also mentions that the team will continue to work on ports which will not only be limited to Nintendo Switch . Unsurprisingly, that has opened the door for a lot of speculation.

Some fans are theorizing that it could lead to PC ports of Nintendo games, but that seems a bit too far-fetched. However, another plausible theory, which actually very well might be the case, is that Nintendo will be using the studio's help to port games to the Nintendo Switch 2. Although Nintendo has confirmed that the Nintendo Switch 2 will be announced pretty soon, it does make sense to simply not refer it to directly for now. Fans have noted that the developers have done commendable work in the past, especially for the port of Mortal Kombat which has improved a lot over time despite launching in a buggy state.

item.title: Diablo 4 Players Discover Unfinished Items While Playing Helltides in Season 4
item.description:
Highlights

  • Diablo 4 players stumbled upon an unreleased Unique amulet called Eye of the Depths during gameplay in Helltides.
  • The unfinished item displays stats like movement speed boosts and critical strike chance, with a TBD effect and WIP inscription.
  • Blizzard has yet to address the presence of the amulet in the game, leaving players to wonder about its fate and impact.

Some Diablo 4 players have found an unreleased item while playing Helltides. One of the biggest charms of the Diablo franchise is the item variety that players can find, and it's no different with Diablo 4 . Diablo 4 players venture into Sanctuary and obtain a range of powerful items, creating the most diverse builds for them.

One of the item types available in Diablo 4 are the Unique amulets, considered the rarest and most powerful amulets in Blizzard's game. Each Diablo 4 class has a Unique amulet, while the Banished Lord's Talisman and the Melted Heart of Selig are Unique amulets for all classes. Getting a Unique item is not easy, with some Diablo 4 players finding them to be rare due to the high tier, but in this case, it's also the fact that this one isn't supposed to be in the game in its current state.

Related
Diablo 4: All Boss Loot Tables

Get that gear grind going with this quick cheat sheet for all the boss drops in Diablo 4.

An unfinished Diablo 4 Unique amulet appeared in the game while players were playing Helltides, as reported by Reddit user Rikukun. In the screenshot, they show an amulet called Eye of the Depths, a Unique Diablo 4 Barbarian item with the inscription "WIP," or work in progress. While the item displays stats such as movement speed boosts and increased critical strike chance, the effect of the Unique amulet appears as "TBD" (to be determined). The same WIP inscription appears in the item's description, indicating that it has made its way into the game ahead of time.

Diablo 4 Players Find an Item that Wasn't Supposed to be in the Game Yet

The Eye of the Depths was originally datamined by Wowhead from the Diablo 4 Season 4 update, confirming the existence of the unique item. On the official Diablo 4 forum, other players report finding the Eye of the Depths amulet while playing Helltides. One of the players notes that they couldn't salvage the Diablo 4 Unique item to obtain Resplendent Spark, a material used to improve armor, weapons, and jewelry. Another Diablo 4 player commented that they managed to equip a gem to the amulet, but didn't reveal the result of the addition.

Blizzard has yet to comment on the status of the unfinished amulet and what it will do with the Diablo 4 players who got the Unique drop. While players wait to discover the fate of the Eye of the Depths, there is plenty of content from Diablo 4 's fourth season to enjoy and, with luck, obtain other rare items already available in the game.

item.title: Pokemon Scarlet And Violet Announces New Limited Time Mystery Gift Pokemon
item.description:
Highlights

  • Don't overlook the Porygon2 Mystery Gift - it's the same one used by a pro player in Pokemon Scarlet and Violet.
  • Exciting rewards and events like the Paradox Tera raid event keep players engaged in Pokemon Scarlet and Violet.
  • Get your hands on the limited-time Porygon2 Mystery Gift - redeem the code at the first Pokemon Center in Los Platos.

Pokemon Scarlet and Violet is giving away yet another Mystery Gift, and this time around it is a Porygon2. While it might not seem like a very lucrative Pokemon to catch, the fact that it is the same one used by a professional Pokemon Scarlet and Violet player makes it something players should definitely have in their collection.

It's been a while since the last major update was released for Pokemon Scarlet and Violet , but the developers have kept fans engaged with a number of exciting rewards and events. Recently, a new Paradox Tera raid event was also announced for Pokemon Scarlet and Violet , featuring the likes of Sandy Shocks and Iron Thorns. This not only gives players a chance to catch various Tera types of Pokemon but also get the lucrative rewards that are associated with 5-star raids.

Related
Pokemon Scarlet and Violet Player Finds Trick To Get Guaranteed Shiny Pokemon

A Pokemon Scarlet & Violet bug allows players to get unlimited shiny versions of a Pokemon, and it is surprisingly easy to pull it off.

The Pokemon Company recently announced an all-new Mystery Gift that players can redeem for a limited time. The distribution is to celebrate the Pokemon North America International Championships 2024 and will be giving players a Porygon2 in Pokemon Scarlet and Violet for free. It should be noted that the code hasn't been announced yet, and it will likely coincide with the start of the event, which kicks off on June 7th. Additionally, the code will only be available until June 10, 2024, at 5:00 p.m. PDT.

There are a couple of things players should note as far as redeeming the code is concerned. For starters, the option is not available from the get-go, and players will need to wait until they reach the first Pokemon Center in Los Platos. This shouldn't take long, and players should be able to reach that point in the first couple of hours or so. Once that's unlocked, players can access the Poke Portal and then redeem the Mystery Gift in Pokemon Scarlet and Violet from there.

Pokemon Scarlet And Violet Porygon2 Mystery Gift Stats

As far as the stats of the Porygon2 are concerned, the fact that it has the same build as the one used by Nils Dunlop to win in the Master's Division of the Pokemon Europe International Championships speaks volumes about its strength. It will be featuring the moves Tera Blast, Ice Beam, Recover, and Trick Room and will have Flying Tera-type. It also comes with the Pokemon Scarlet and Violet held item Eviolite , which boosts both the Defense and Special Defense stat of the Pokemon. Perhaps the most exciting part of the giveaway is the fact that it comes in a Cherish Ball, something that players are always looking forward to.
